StatDef.label: mental age
StatDef.description: This value, a combination of physical age, personal preference, development and regression effects controls the behaviour of this pawn in multiple situations.\n\nA 40 year old pawn can still behave like a 3 year old toddler, while a 12 year old can be very grown up for their age and behave like a 16 year old for example.

StatDef.label: mental regression
StatDef.description: This value represents the amount of mental regression affecting this pawn. It makes the pawn behave younger, the higher the amount is.\n\nHas a direct affect on mental age.

StatDef.label: mental age limit
StatDef.description: The maximum mental age can be limited by behaviour preferences, mental capacity, chemical or physical intervention.
